item.title: Project Sunset Announcement
item.dc:creator: TalalM
item.description:
Project sunset after 3 years for the following reasons

  • Speedify officially supports OpenWrt as of Q4 2024
  • GL.iNet auto build repos went private, certain patches for wlan-ap are missing.
  • Wi-Fi is unstable when using official OpenWrt sources on most GL.iNet devices.
  • Speedify now requires a seperate subscription for routers and the pricing is very steep for me.
    Update: 3 years plan with occasional discounts is now on par with family plan

Thank you contributors, Speedify support, and donors!

Donate to Parrot Rescue Lebanon if you found this helpful spoiler

Discord chat has not been archived for user privacy reasons.
Wiki site address moved to Github pages

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: Speedify now supports OpenWrt officially
item.dc:creator: TalalM
item.description:
Routers now require a license.
Installation proccess requires knowledge with OpenWrt.
Performance should be better than SmoothWAN and the unofficial installer.

1 post - 1 participant

Read full topic

item.title: DNS Server Address Default - How to Change?
item.dc:creator: garyd
item.description:
Hi Developer, and enthusiast,

First of all, I am really thanking the dev who made this possible.

Today I have managed to install SmoothWAN to my SlateAX router.

However, right off the bat, after installing it, I was not able to login to the gui. So, what I did was, change the IP address, since I was able to ssh.

I’m not knowledgeable in firewalls and openwrt, but I can read instructions and guides

Could someone please, tell me how to change the DNS server IP issue by the router?

Because, it is still using 172.17.17.2.

I’ve updated the router IP address to 192.168.222.1 , since I can’t access the web ui via the default 172.17.17.2. It was so strange why so, because on another machine I can access it.

The current setting now is 192.168.222.1, but the DNS the router is giving is 172.17.17.2
I’ve already did:
Network > DHCP and DNS > DNS forwardings:
1.1.1.1
Can someone please, help!

5 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: DNS Server Address Default - How to Change?

item.title: Save changes to WAN Interface - Engarde
item.dc:creator: squirrel
item.description:
Hello,

I’ve set the Override IPv4 routing table for WAN interface to BYP1. However, any changes to WAN interface resets on restart of the device. Is there a simple, noob-friendly solution to keep it fixed to BYP1?

Edit: This only happens to the WAN interface created by engarde. Any changes, including custom DNS, also gets reset to default upon device restart. I’m using Raspberry Pi 4.

item.source: Save changes to WAN Interface - Engarde

item.title: Install on internal results in boot loop
item.dc:creator: ievis
item.description:
I have a J4125 router (the Chinese PC/OpnSense routers)

I can flash and run SmoothWAN from USB with no issues using “SmoothWAN-0.99.9HF5-PC-EFI-AMD64-DiskImage-or-WebUI.img.gz” but if i try to install on the inbuilt SSD I get a boot loop. OpenWrt installs and runs with no issues. I have tried the following to no avail.

Run SmoothWAN from USB and install on internal SSD the way SmoothWAN guide suggest
SmoothWAN from USB and install on internal SSD the way OpenWRT is installed
Linux LiveUSB. Installed mkusb and cloned extracted img file to internal SSD.

All three result in the same bootloops

Any help?

Cheers

item.title: SmoothWAN on Proxmox - IP addresses
item.dc:creator: stuupifiedbyspeedify
item.description:
Hello,

I was so excited to see there is a SmoothWAN VMWare image that could be used with Proxmox! I’ve gone ahead and followed the instructions in the guide and I currently have the guest running. However, I have one small issue…

My Proxmox node has been a part of my infrastructure for some time and already provides other services for my network (on the 192.168 private address scheme). So, now that I’ve created the SmoothWAN guest, I can’t access it at the 172 addressing scheme.

I’ve made a backup of the guest before I start futzing around too much… But how difficult will it be for me to change the SmoothWAN guest to operate on a 192 address? If I just change the IP address of the machine, what will break? What other apps have been installed and configured that will stop working?

I’m going to give it a try… But, please let me know if there are any known issues or steps that I need to consider in switching the SmoothWAN instance over to a different subnet.

Thank you!

CB

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: I have a Slate GL-Net Router, Downloaded Speedify - now What?
item.dc:creator: Jax5er
item.description:
Newbie, Got file, downloaded the file onto my Slate Ax Router, now I can not connect to my Router. Connects actually but says no Internet. I look for the WiFi SmoothWAN Setup but also not there. I thought was next step. Not sure what to do?

Steps I took:
Router on, PC signed into GL 5G wifi from router. On PC went to router webpage address and under upgrades downloaded and brought over file to install. I did hit Keep settings - (Maybe my issue) It installed, once done no access to that webpage address any longer, and no wifi to select called SmoothWan. My Router wifi shows up still, I connect but no interent?

Any help would be great.

Thanks,

Brandon

item.title: Using smoothwan as AP , upstream with 2 wifi clients and 1 wired connection (speedify)
item.dc:creator: aloft
item.description:
I’d like to use Smoothwan on a RPI , where the RPI acts as the Access Points for my clients . The upstream consists of one wired connection, and 2 wifi connections , which will be bonded with Speedify.

The RPI has one wifi chip on board, so I would need to add two Wifi USB chips.

Is this possible with Smoothwan? And is it possible with a RPI ? I understand there might be some performance hits on frequency level due to running 3 wifi connections simultaneously, but am I wondering the the RPI and software can manage that all wifi connections at once.

item.title: AdGuard breaks Tmobile connections
item.dc:creator: drmrfancypants
item.description:
For the first time I tried adguard home feature today.
The Adguard GUI indicated it was working fine with metrics and whatnot.
Unfortunately, it immediately caused strange behavior in the Speedify GUI within smoothwan. Every other refresh cycle for the connection info it showed the 2 TMobile connections as dropped off of the active connection list or at the very least with 0 download, but my starlink and Pair and Share connections worked fine. (interestingly the phones connected through pair and share are google fi through TMobile)
If i disable Adguard home and reboot the router, all is back to normal.

item.title: Avahai mDNS reflector setup
item.dc:creator: kuz
item.description:
Instructions:
Log onto your firewall Luci web interface and go to Network → Firewall → Traffic Rules tab. Under Open ports on router add a new rule for mDNS. This will be for UDP on port 5353

Question:
When I look in this tab/section I am missing the “Open ports on router” section. Any advice on fixing this or possibly setting this up without the gui?

Source:
https://blog.christophersmart.com/2020/03/30/resolving-mdns-across-vlans-with-avahi-on-openwrt/

4 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Simplest hardware option
item.dc:creator: sean
item.description:
I have both RPI4 and NanoPi R5S hardware sitting around doing very little. I thought that this project might be a good use of them, however we rely on our broadband for our business, and I want to make sure it’s as easy to look after and reliable as possible.

Currently, we have a FTTC VDSL modem connected over PPPoE into our QNAP router, which has ASUS AImesh hanging off it for Wifi, and draytek 10G switches for 10G to our desktops and 1G elsewhere.

I don’t want to provide another wifi network, so the RPI option doesn’t look like it would work well. If I went for a Flint or Slate device, can I combine two ethernet WAN’s into one WAN into the QNAP router?

Sean

2 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Engarde - Lag spikes and low TX
item.dc:creator: anon83253404
item.description:
Hello,

I am experiencing lag spikes in online games only when using engarde. The nature of lag spikes is such that sometimes my ping shoots up and keeps on increasing until it either returns to normal within few seconds or I get disconnected.

I have tried using each of my internet separately to isolate any issues, however the lag issue remains. This issue is persistent as long as I am using engarde with either single or dual internets. It never happens with normal WireGuard in SmoothWAN. So this is clearly something related to engarde (client or server side settings).

Further, I noticed that the “TX” data usage is very low as shown in SmoothWAN, for example:
RX: 31.59 GB (27575987 Pkts.)
TX: 3.59 GB (23370358 Pkts.)

In my limited knowledge, I had thought maybe it’s something to do with MTU or ‘keep persistent = 25’ settings but changing it didn’t seem to have an effect - I’m not sure.

Could any of this information give a clue about what’s happening?

9 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Engarde - Lag spikes and low TX

item.title: Forwarding and policy to router behind SmoothWAN router
item.dc:creator: velocity7
item.description:
Hi, I have a router connected to my home network, which is then connected to a Slate AX running SmoothWAN, and the Slate AX is also running Speedify. I’m trying to do the following but having difficulty getting the right settings:

  1. Be able to do any kind of port forwarding to the internal router, whether that be from wan/wan6 (connectify0) or from portone/porttwo (eth0/eth1). So far I haven’t been able to get a standard FTP server on port 21 to be visible to the internet, whether I check from wan/wan6 or eth0/eth1.
  2. Be able to force things like BitTorrent to not operate on Speedify (e.g., force them to operate on either eth0 or eth1 only), even if it means restricting which port that BitTorrent can operate on. I have tried the Speedify Custom Bypass with ports used by BitTorrent with no success. It has worked for domains at the very least.

4 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic
item.source: Forwarding and policy to router behind SmoothWAN router

item.title: Bypass Speedify for specific (V)LAN
item.dc:creator: timirvin
item.description:
Hi,

I followed the instructions in Bypass clients to a specific WAN - SmoothWAN to bypass a specific LAN (VLAN actually) to a specific WAN interface.

The issue I ran into is one I did that, that WAN is removed from the “main” routing table, and so when I deactivate Speedify the traffic is forced over the other WAN (which in my case is the less desirable WAN interface).

Once I setup the bypass as instructed, this is what I ended up with:

root@SmoothWAN:~# ip rule
0:      from all lookup local
1:      from 10.26.11.0/24 iif br-lan.2 lookup BYP1
5210:   from all fwmark 0x80000/0xff0000 lookup main
5230:   from all fwmark 0x80000/0xff0000 lookup default
5250:   from all fwmark 0x80000/0xff0000 unreachable
5270:   from all lookup 52
10000:  from 100.98.168.38 lookup BYP1
20000:  from all to 100.98.168.38/10 lookup BYP1
32766:  from all lookup main
32767:  from all lookup default
90010:  from all iif lo lookup BYP1
root@SmoothWAN:~# ip route
0.0.0.0/1 dev connectify0 scope link
default via 10.202.0.1 dev connectify0 proto static
default via 100.65.134.17 dev wwan0 proto static src 100.65.134.16 metric 20
10.26.10.0/24 dev br-lan.1 proto kernel scope link src 10.26.10.1
10.26.11.0/24 dev br-lan.2 proto kernel scope link src 10.26.11.1
10.202.0.0/24 dev connectify0 proto kernel scope link src 10.202.0.2
100.65.134.0/27 dev wwan0 proto static scope link metric 20
123.123.123.123 via 100.65.134.17 dev wwan0
128.0.0.0/1 dev connectify0 scope link
root@SmoothWAN:~# ip route list table BYP1
default via 100.64.0.1 dev eth0 proto static src 100.98.168.38 metric 10
34.120.255.244 dev eth0 proto static scope link src 100.98.168.38 metric 10
100.64.0.0/10 dev eth0 proto static scope link metric 10
192.168.100.1 dev eth0 proto static scope link src 100.98.168.38 metric 10
root@SmoothWAN:~#

You can see that the route via “eth0” has disappeared from the “main” routing table and only appears in the “BYP1” table.

So, if I deactivate Speedify this is what the “main” table now looks like:

root@SmoothWAN:~# ip route
default via 100.65.134.17 dev wwan0 proto static src 100.65.134.16 metric 20
10.26.10.0/24 dev br-lan.1 proto kernel scope link src 10.26.10.1
10.26.11.0/24 dev br-lan.2 proto kernel scope link src 10.26.11.1
100.65.134.0/27 dev wwan0 proto static scope link metric 20
123.123.123.123 via 100.65.134.17 dev wwan0

So all traffic is now heading out “wwan0”. In this case, I’d like traffic in “main” and “BYP1” tables to both use “eth0” and “wwan0” is relegated to “metric 20” and ostensibly unused.

Tim

10 posts - 3 participants

Read full topic

item.title: SmoothWAN Engarde on Oracle Cloud
item.dc:creator: anon83253404

I have spent many months configuring SmoothWAN with Engarde on my Raspberry Pi 4. I love using SmoothWAN. However, I cannot get it to work on Oracle Cloud VPS or Amazon AWS due to my limited knowledge - I believe they require some changes to the syntax in cloud init script, in order to work on Oracle/AWS?

The guidelines specify how to set it up on Vultr using Cloud init script. However, Vultr seems to trigger huge latency spikes in some games. The same script does not work on Oracle/AWS.

Can someone please help set up SmoothWAN with Engarde on Oracle Cloud? A script for AWS EC2 would be a bonus!

Thanks in advance!

item.title: Mystery route 123.123.123.123
item.dc:creator: timirvin
item.description:
I’m running on a PC-based platform, with non-USB Ethernet ports, and a Quectel EC25 LTE modem. I am using this image: SmoothWAN-0.99.9HF5-PC-EFI-AMD64-DiskImage-or-WebUI.img

I have the following extras activated:
– Speedify
– Tailscale

The following route is in my routing table, and I don’t know why, or how it was installed:

123.123.123.123 via 100.68.15*.** dev wwan0

“wwan0” is the Quectel-based 4G-LTE Cellular connection.

123.123.123.123 is a Chinese-based IP which makes this seem even more suspicious.

This is a new install and configuration, I started working on this last week and just got things working a day or so ago. I don’t recall this route being there prior to the SPeedify or Tailscale install, so I suspect one of those.
I’m using ModemManager to configure the Quectel interface, so tht could potentially be the culprit.

Here are the logs and config from the machine:
https://send.bitwarden.com/#WKz7pSpkpkekz7CRAFEnNw/Juq7vbLfAcHwuCoTDQlDwg

Any idea what is installing this route, and more importantly, why?

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic

item.title: Speedify UI not working
item.dc:creator: timirvin
item.description:
I am scratching and clawing my way to get this SmoothWAN firewall setup.

I’m running on a PC-based platform, with non-USB Ethernet ports, and a Quectel EC25 LTE modem. I am using this image: SmoothWAN-0.99.9HF5-PC-EFI-AMD64-DiskImage-or-WebUI.img

I finally figured out I needed to deactivate the “Unique USB network interface naming” to get the QMI interface on the Quectel to work (though it wouldn’t work with the QMI Cellular interface type, but ModemManager does work, so that is fine). I can pass traffic through this interface now.

I then finally figured out I needed to delete the WAN and WAN6 interfaces and recreate a new WAN interface on “eth0” for my second (Ethernet-based) Internet connection. That Internet path is also working.

So, I then installed Speedify using the Luci UI, and new WAN and WAN6 interfaces were created pointing to “connectify0”, but with an error that the “Network device is not present”. If I go to the “Overview” screen, the “Speedify UI” frame just says “Restart Speedify Service”. Running “ps” from an ssh session I see “./speedify -d logs” running. I have rebooted and I have restarted Speedify multiple times using the Luci UI. The “logs” tab in the Luci VPN->Speedify section shows nothing.

The Logs and Configs are available here (for 7 days): Bitwarden Send

Any help would be very appreciated.

Tim

3 posts - 2 participants

Read full topic
